website_summaries.verdict: Combines Bluetooth smart technology with high quality durability.
pros: Pairs with Polar Beat App so there is no need to have your phone on you when you workout
5 kHz transmission tracks heart rate in the water
Silicone dots keep strap in place
cons: This is an expensive strap, compared to other models

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Consider yourself lucky if the bluetooth works. This is the worst bluetooth operated health device I have ever owned, and not to mention the app that is buggy which continuously tells me my device is connected to some other app. Returning it back and wouldn't recommend this to anyone or any other polar product. How can a company even put a product like this on the market without adequate testing? unbelievable! I wish i could give it negative stars.
customer_reviews.author: Khem Singh

customer_reviews.title: This heart rate monitor is 100% accurate all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this song heart rate monitor. I recently had heart surgery and am back in the gym. This monitor allows me to use any of the equipment in the gym and it will allow me to monitor my heart rate. So, if I’m taking a spin class, working out on the treadmill, stationary bicycle or elliptical trainer they ALL syncs with this monitor. During cardiac rehab I often check against my own monitor and it is usually 100% accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Solon Rosenblatt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always save training sessions on the device
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the Polar H10 has a pretty big flaw in their Polar Beat app. On both iPhone and Android phones the app creates multiple bluetooth connections. If you have your phone with you it works fine. I bought the H10 specifically because it can save the training session, and download it later (risky to kayak with cell phone). Sometimes it downloads the saved data, but most often it is lost. Customer service is terrible. Overwhelmed obviously by problems like this. They finally confirmed this is a "known problem" but no idea when it will get fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Bartlett3000

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase if you plan to incorporate heart rate monitoring into your workouts.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few sessions and then the issues started. Wouldn’t pair with Polar’s apps. Had to download a 3rd party app to use as a heart rate monitor. Recently, communication to iPhone has been compromised. Heart rate readings either do not occur or are blatantly wrong. Tech support from Polar poor.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know why I keep buying this HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: The Polar brand is not good at all. Stay away from this product! This is my second one and I’ve only had it for 2 days and it already doesn’t work. It’s connected to Bluetooth and unless I’m dead it can’t pick up a heart rate. Waste of money. Go somewhere else!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Try something else...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. It worked fine the first couple of times I used it, and then after that I was never able to get it to pair with the Polar app (even though the Bluetooth on my phone was pairing with it). If you can get it to pair, then its great... but spending 30 minutes trying to get it to pair to the app is a waste of my time. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza N Alkire

customer_reviews.title: Polar Makes Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working two months after purchase. Conveniently, this is past the 30 days required for a refund. This is the third Polar product that stopped working within a year of purchase and this is a record for how fast it broke. Don't waste your time with Polar products.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Constant Pairing Problems
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but pairing problems. I have the latest phones too, 11 Pro Max and Note 10+, and, yes, the battery is at 100%. Such a shame...
customer_reviews.author: zwiepak

customer_reviews.title: Extremely short life for a $85 product.
customer_reviews.text: Have had the unit about four months and have most recently it stopped functioning. I changed batteries. Worked for a moment then stopped working. Changed batteries again. Same result. Using brand new energizer brand batteries which I’ve verified with a meter that they are indeed good. Past the window to return. Would not recommend this product. I got four months use for a $85 product. Like other users that have experienced similar outcomes would like to give a few negative stars, giving one is way too generous. Hope this helps anyone with their buying decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Stone

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof as promised
customer_reviews.text: It says completely waterproof and accurate for swimming. The second you hit the water it stops tracking your HR and only when you get out or stand up at the end of each lap will it register your HR. H7 does the same thing, that's why I got the H10. Sending back, this is worthless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kianne Holt

customer_reviews.title: Tried them all - Simply the best chest-strap HRM there is
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of athletes, I have some benign tachycardia issues. I've used Garmin straps for years, but the moment you have a PVC (premature ventricular contraction), the Garmin pod has no idea of what to do, and starts to mis-report your actual HR. I tried them all, the dual band one was better, but still had issues. Finally, I decided to jump ships and try this Polar model. I'd used Polar straps in the '90's, they worked, but were even more glitchy. Not this one. Rock solid results in any condition, super accurate. Having troubles getting reliable readings? Buy this strap.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: I feel scammed: The strap came and no monitor.
customer_reviews.text: The product showed up with just a strap and no monitor. I feel scammed.
customer_reviews.author: john chin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after about 12 uses, unfortunately it was just outside the amazon return window. Customer service is not great, basically you have to pay to have it sent somewhere etc etc Bottom line. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne C

customer_reviews.title: Bypass the Bluetooth apps and get this
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit of a pain to put this on, but it just works. I tried using numerous Bluetooth apps to use my Apple Watch as a heart monitor for my Peloton, but all have connection issues and blame Apple, Peloton and Android. I now use this sensor, either in Ant+ or Bluetooth mode and it just works. I put it on, start my workout and it instantly connects and gives accurate measurements. I only used the app to enable the Bluetooth mode on the sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Great product..horrible app.
customer_reviews.text: Built well. very accurate. and when i finished my workout on the treadmill.. the treadmill automatically would read my polar HRM and displayed it without me having to do anything.. that was really cool. Reason i gave it 4/5 because POLAR's beat app is trash. It couldn't even pair with the sensor. I downloaded a different workout out that uses ANT+. I hate when companies invest little in the way of user interfaces and backend things. SO that's why i give it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity Issues - FAIL
customer_reviews.text: I'm guessing Polar has quality assurance issues given both the high reviews and significant number of customers with bad units. Unable to reliably pair. Replaced battery, factory reset, attempted connecting with two different phones, using the Polar app-- no workie. Really disappointed in Polar. I have $15 BT devices that pair instantly everytime. Maybe I'll spin the wheel again and see if I get a non defective unit but for now returning it for refund. Missed my chance to run this am due to screwing around with something that should be plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Millard

customer_reviews.title: Frustration does increase my HR, though.
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. After 1y of frustrating use, I've begun using my old polar H7s which still work better than the h10. Also I've begun looking for a different fitness system. Hard to connect to my pixel 4 and prior 2. Eats batteries. Ugh. Biggest challenge is the connection to get started. I don't need frustration of no fitness connection to discourage my workout! I've messaged them on their app to no avail. Then I simply bear with their app message telling me that I would have a better workout experience if I had a cardio sensor!?! I agree - Even though I've purchased 2 of these and 2-3 H7s!
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Update loop failure
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, this thing refuses to update the firmware. I've gone through the whole process of restarting Bluetooth on my phone, restarting my phone, removing it and re-pairing it, even attempting a different phone. Nothing. It still works fine enough, which is why I gave it a second star, but for a simple piece of tech, it shouldn't have issues updating the firmware. That's just crazy, especially for how much it is. And having multiple apps, and only one of them working with this device seems excessive. I don't think I'll be using Polar products again. Too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work inside the gym
customer_reviews.text: The H10 chest heart monitor was supposed to link with the Polar ignite watch without interference from other equipment. It worked fine in the parking lot with heart rate around 80 BPM, but inside the gym on treadmill it dropped to under 60 BPM—which had to be totally wrong. This is the third H10 I've tried, all with same problem. Called Polar customer service and they said return to seller for refund or send to them for warranty work which would take minimum of couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Mack, PCC

customer_reviews.title: This thing never works
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could lift without wearing my Apple Watch on my wrist but it never works. I never know if it’s connected or not and when it does it’ll stay active for a while 10 seconds and then shut off again, or it’ll tell me another app is using it but idk which app because it’s not connected to my fitness app and it doesn’t record any of my workout data. I’m so disappointed in this product and I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Keven

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Chest Strap Monitors from three different manufactures. Although I always want to like the others more, I end up almost grudgingly hacking to admit that the Polar devices last longer, are easier to use. For me I am happy with 7 and the 10. I would buy another 10 when purchasing because for the price I think it is better to go with the newer Device. After ten years of using a Chest satrap, I tell my friends to purchase the Polar Strap and that is my choice when I use as a gift
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of use, the heart monitor works well. The Polar Beat and Polar Flow apps are pretty good. It is not the easiest to pair with your smartphone... a little counter intuitive. It took me a couple of days and some significant frustration to NOT pair (I actually had to "forget the device") the H10 with my Bluetooth connection on my phone. The heart rate monitor and the app pair together automatically. If you do add the H10 device to your Bluetooth phone setting - IT DOES NOT WORK!!! So far so good. Not sure about battery life given I have only had a 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Great value purchase and very accurate! I've used many polar products, always with a chest strap heart monitor. I got this to use with the Polar Beat and Polar Flow apps. It's spectacular with the Polar Beat app and it's large selection of activities. I will also use it to measure a project or activity like yard work, house projects using the Other Outdoor or Other Indoor selection. I recommended this to several people, one who had been complaining about the inaccurate data she and her husband were getting from their Apple Fitbits. She was elated so much after using it, they both purchased one.
customer_reviews.author: tag_rrgj

customer_reviews.title: This tells me how fast my heart is beating. I believe it, because smart people told me to.
customer_reviews.text: This device is comfortable to the degree that I don't really notice I'm wearing it. It interfaces with my phone and my VR headset perfectly. The phone app seems serviceable enough; turning off the stupid voice prompts ("you are burning fat!" umm...thanks?) improved the situation. I believe it is accurate, because the innerwebs told me it was the most accurate device available, which is why I bought it. Without sitting around and checking with a stopwatch, I can't independently verify that. Inasmuch as I'm never going to do that, I will continue to assume it tells me the right number.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter L.

customer_reviews.title: compatibility with Keiser M3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device primarily to use with an older Keiser M3 spin cycle. I am pleased to report that it is fully compatible. This device works with Bluetooth, GymLink and ANT+ devices. When I started working the Keiser M3 cycle it found the H10 immediately. No need to pair, as I understand it the M3 is GymLink compatible. The H10 s can sometimes lose the ability to read your heart rate. The electrodes that contact your skin need to be moist to get a good reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the price
customer_reviews.text: After a double bypass and Stent procedures, last year keeping track of my HR has become an important part of my daily life. So, I wear the Polar H10 HRM band almost daily in conjunction with my Garmin Fenix 5x watch to keep track of my HR over extended periods, during all sorts of activities, gym workouts, and golf. It connects easily through Bluetooth with a number of gym exercise machines and works great with the Polar Beat app. Worth its price.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Apple Watch 4
customer_reviews.text: This works with my Apple Watch 4. My watch has a heart rate monitor but it is not instantaneously and actually slightly delayed. Adding this to my watch will give me the heart rate more accurately without any delay. It helps me with my running by maintaining a sudden heart rate so I don’t over exert myself. I have owned many polar products before and this one is as good as the other products that i have.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Works fine now that I  use a conductive gel.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the comfort & accuracy. The Polar Beat app and my regular cardio on a precor 100i AMT are always within a one beat difference. The app could be improved but I wont critique it here. At first I was disappoinred, but when I started using conductive gel and put it over my heart rather in the middle of my chest it works just fine. I'm recovering from heart surgery, so it's important that I have a reliable monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Oberg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on Peloton (home) and Life Fitness Cycle (in da club)
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and actually works better when you sweat, unlike the iWatch. Connects to the two things I use perfectly (unlike iWatch), every time without any issues. I use it on Peloton at home and Life Fitness Cycle IC7 at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: chooch

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, accurate heart rate. No other functions afaik
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would wear this monitor during sleep. Not necessary - my Polar watch already does everything. The only function of this heart rate belt is to measure the heart rate more accurately than the watch itself. The calorie count (i.e. average heart rate) will not change much, regardless of whether you wear the belt or not. The big difference with the belt is that it responds faster than the watch. The watch takes between 30 and 60 seconds to catch up to an increase of 30 bpm. All it means is that wearing the belt gives you more control over your exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Folger

customer_reviews.title: Good Heart Rate Monitor with Connectivity Issues
customer_reviews.text: I use this product regularly since receiving it, and it does an excellent job of monitoring my heart rate while being comfortable to wear during workouts. However, the Polar H10 has consistent issues in properly connecting via bluetooth to my iPhone. Every time I want to use the Polar H10, I have to disconnect and reconnect the Polar device to my iPhone multiple times then open the Polar app to determine if the monitor is working properly. Eventually the Polar H10 properly reads my heartbeat, but then will cease to work if I stop the workout session. This is certainly a frustrating glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Watson

customer_reviews.title: First use of product - all good
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised that H10 strap, sensor, tx, and apps Polar Beat and Flow worked fine. Brief tech call to Polar on apps use went well. Apps easy to use with my iPhone 6, but on bottom of learning curve to interpret results. Still in the all’s well phase, though. Will report ups and downs as months go by. Nothing’s going to go good forever. For now I’m thrilled it’s ok out of box. About 10 yrs ago tried one or two HR sensors with not so good results. Maybe techs better now. Using it to watch my strength, fitness, and tennis training.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Pairing inconsistency sucks
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when the Polar HRM monitor arrived that I tried it out that very same day - set-up was easy, band comfortable and pairing a cinch. The days after were the problematic: pairing would drop in-and-out during workout, or device wouldn’t even register. I went through troubleshooting but the darn thing still does not consistently monitor HR. Well, you win some and you lose some - and I lost with this HRM.
customer_reviews.author: ADB

customer_reviews.title: Great for Peloton Bike
customer_reviews.text: I use this heart rate monitor with my Peloton bike and it works perfectly. My Peloton bike automatically connects to this device when I put it together and put it on. I definitely recommend this heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin V

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of privacy
customer_reviews.text: Good heart rate monitor, however be aware that all your data will be sent to third parties. According to text when signing up, you will have the option of opting out on your settings, but once you try to opt out they “can’t provide you with the service” so you can’t opt out if you want your reading.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Brown

customer_reviews.title: 2 week review
customer_reviews.text: I returned this, but not because of this product, but because the Polar app features I wanted to use were compatible with the Polar Ignite watch. So I bought the watch. While I had this heart rate monitor, I used it every time I worked out. I followed the instructions and didn't have connection issues. It connected to my phone and the elliptical simultaneously without issues. The Polar app and elliptical metrics were identical. If I was in the market for a heart rate monitor, I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nazim A.

customer_reviews.title: Its great when it works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this heart rate monitor 6 or 7 times. It seems to be working and then I will do some sprints and it says my heart rate is 70, while I'm in decent shape....that can't be right. Sometimes when I put it on, it tells me my heart rate is super low right from the start, and I know its not going to be accurate so I don't bother to wear it. I leave it alone for a few days and then it seems to work fine?? I'm not sure why, but I think I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy with the app DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The strap itself is fine BUT the interface with the Polar Beat app isn’t good. I constantly have to unpair the strap with the app. And the app has a challenging time finding the strap. I end up monkeying around with the app when I just want to do my run. Accurate? Yes. Glitchy? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Reliable for Cycling, Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The H10 has been working reliably for a couple of months now. The strap is sturdy, and the monitor works without me splashing water on my chest. The free Polar Beat app is easy to use, large display is easy to read while cycling. I really like the heart rate zones on the app; they're color coded so I can instantly tell if I'm in the correct range. The app monitors location, speed and heart rate. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: No better than Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known that it needs a phone ap to work. I don’t like carrying my phone around when I exercise and this doesn’t link directly to my Apple Watch. I was hoping to get more accurate measuring than my watch offers. It does a good job of keeping up to the second heart rate, but is about comparable to my Apple Watch.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D Cushing

customer_reviews.title: In a stand alone mode, no way to know if it is recording!
customer_reviews.text: I had great hopes for H10. I still do if I can buy a good running watch that reads H10. In any case, since it is advertised as standalone chest trap that records your HR and can be downloaded on a computer. i have used Polar chest straps for many many years. Why doesn't H10 have small LED that lights up when the strap has made electrical contacts to your body. This way I know if I need to add more water to the strap or apply a conducting Gel.
customer_reviews.author: Jaque

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not XXL
customer_reviews.text: I saw M-XXL and didn't notice 26-36. 26-36 is M-L, not XL or XXL. I wear XL or XXL. strap is uncomfortably tight fully let out. clasp is inconveniently located making it hard to put on. also could not get to pair with my iPhone. I was pleasantly surprise it worked with my Pro-Form treadmill without any setup.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

customer_reviews.title: Works with ant and bluetooth devices
customer_reviews.text: Had the same item, but 8 yrs old and it stopped working. Bought this and it syncs with my Polar FT7 watch and also the Endomondo app on my phone. The heart rate between and app and my phone display identical numbers. This HRM seems to sync quicker with my watch compared to the older on. I ordered the large strap and have to have it extended all the way. If my chest was 4-6 inches larger it would be too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll B

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This totally upped my work outs completely. I’m working with a nutritionist and personal trainer whom highly recommended this product for me to keep track of my work outs. I do combat sports and needed to work my cardio back up. This is awesome! Really keeps track of my heart rate well. Easy to clean and use. The app has so Many exercises and sports to program it to. If your in the market for a heart rate monitor I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Venus A Smith

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE quality, 2 of these broke within 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a loyal Polar customer for 5 years. I recently decided to upgrade from my older model HR monitor to this H10 and it has been nothing but problems. I ordered 2 of these- 1 for me and 1 for my husband. We received them in December 2019, and by mid-Jan 2020 mine had stopped working. I replaced the battery and did a “hard reset”, nothing worked. Now in March 2020 my husbands has stopped working too! We’ve never had these issues with our older Polar monitors. This H10 is a DUD. Save yourself the money and frustration and do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina

customer_reviews.title: Polar H10 Works with Xterra ERG600W Water Rower on 5kHz Frequency
customer_reviews.text: Looks big and bulky in picture; it's not! Slim, thin and lightweight. Nice design and gone is the throwaway strap/unit with a non-replaceable battery. You can replace the 2025 button battery on your own with the twist of the battery cover using a coin. NICE! Polar H10 Works with my new Xterra ERG600W Water Rower on a 5.3 kHz Frequency. Very happy with this unit. Is very expensive unit, my only complaint. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but, no Polar Bears on new Huawei phones
customer_reviews.text: Already been a user of a H10 for many months and now bought one for the wife. Not sure what to say, it does exactly what it says it will. Excellent product. Note to Huawei users, Polar Beats doesn't seem to want to install from APK on the wife's P40 Pro. Google have recently plugged the hole to install GMS services. You can't use Polar Bears app, you'll have to use one of the many others.
customer_reviews.author: Stuza

customer_reviews.title: Works reasonably well - But should warn that battery is low
customer_reviews.text: I've used this almost daily for running, HIIT, biking, and jiu jitsu. I started having issues with erratic monitoring, and sometimes I would have to forget and repair the device. Turns out the battery was dying. The Polar Beats program will should be able to alert that the battery is low on the H10. Other than that, the unit seems to work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J. Dion

customer_reviews.title: Use for cycling
customer_reviews.text: Been using Polar HRM products since 2001, always find them to be reliable and well made. This is no exception, the mobile apps are great and high quality. I'd go so far as to say it rivals Strava in quality of app.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jones

customer_reviews.title: Functional HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: The Polar H10 allows you to connect to Bluetooth driven apps and devices. It does not provide the accurate monitoring that is claimed in the advertising. Many drops in monitoring occur during training in spite of strict adherence to operating instructions. The frequent drops affect the accuracy of performance summaries. At this price, a HR monitor should work as advertised. The H10 performed no better than devices at half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Publius Petronius

customer_reviews.title: Works on ALL of our exercise equipment
customer_reviews.text: Compatible with all three standard heart sensor wireless protocols. We have two of these — one each for myself and my wife — and use them with our Versaclimber, Concept 2 rower, NordicTrack stationary bike and treadmill. No more changing to a different sensor for each piece of equipment. The iPhone app is handy, too.
customer_reviews.author: William Ender

customer_reviews.title: This monitor will suddenly stop working,
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Polar H10 monitor I purchased...within two years. It suddenly stopped working - like the previous one. For 4 or 5 days it would prompt me to pair with my phone prior to working out, then yesterday just quit. The battery is new, and despite how much I play with the Polar and try and re-sync it to my phone, it will not sync. I’m not in the habit of paying $75-85 for a piece of equipment each year that should last many years. Polar, I want to like your products, but not when they fall apart like this. Either you have quality control problems, or a deficient product.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this frequently and for long enough that I have changed the battery. It still works very well, and I like that it coordinates with my treadmill so that I can see my heart rate on the screen, instead of constantly looking at my watch.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Moore

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The POLAR H10 Heart Rate Monitor is not a ECG/EKG recorder. After a 30 minute run, the app showed I had run 0.01 mile and had a heart rate of 2BPM. The H10 does not produce anything like an EKG graph. False advertising. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: No Jump Roping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to track my heart rating while doing my favorite exercise, jump roping. Received my tracker, downloaded the app, only to find out that Jump Roping is not a trackable activity. However, wheelchair racing, Latin dancing, and "Show" are.... Very disappointed. I have no idea if the tracker even worked as I never tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Product!
customer_reviews.text: Started with the H9. That one at least worked a bit for about a week until I couldn't get the device to pair with Polar Beat app for nothing. Returned and decided to try the H10. Never even got a workout in with that piece of junk. Checked connectivity as soon as it arrived and paired with my iPhone, but never paired again after 2 workout attempts. Always assumed the Polar brand was very reputable, but this guy will never buy a product of theirs again!
customer_reviews.author: john kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Factory reset to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and change batteries on. Strap felt high quality. No real issues. . . BEYOND THE FACT THAT IT BROKE AFTER THREE MONTHS OF USE. Update: Did a full factory reset on it and it has started being recognized again. Frustrating as there is no visual way to debug what is happening, and their support site is basic closed for COVID (which is fully understandable and forgivable).
customer_reviews.author: N.G.

customer_reviews.title: More accurate than my Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: The Polar H10 is easy to use. It connected easily to my Ant+ bike computer and, via Bluetooth, to my Giant Road e+ and Giant RideControl app. As stated above, it is more accurate than my FitBit and helps me to stay in my target heart range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: App Connected Polar HRM
customer_reviews.text: I've been training w/a heart rate monitor for 20 years, primarily to track heart rates and workouts. I just bought my first Bluetooth app-connected Polar and I love it! I love the route maps, love the pacing information and also using it to track my personal training and pilates sessions. For me part of the satisfaction of exercise is the accomplishment--of a distance, an average HR, a pace and a calorie burn. I still use my Polar wrist "watch" in conjunction, though it's not necessary. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product while I’m out and about to check my heart rate as I have POTS (causes high heart rate). It helps me monitor my heart rate while I’m shopping or going for a walk. I chose this product specifically because it’s the most accurate heart rate monitor I’ve found so far (it matches the readings on my oximeter). I definitely recommend this product to anyone who needs to see their heart rate! The app is convenient and easy to use. It also shows you a workout summary with your highest heart rate and average heart rate. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Henry & Debra Fraze

customer_reviews.title: Very good heart rate monitor but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I am doing strength and cardio exercises. The heart rate is read continuously on my Polar watch (not part of this purchase) that provides an average and maximum heart rate for the exercise period. The heart rate can also be read on my treadmill. It is superior to the heart rate monitor that came with the Polar watch--a more comfortable chest strap, easier to get on and off, and a replaceable battery. I clean the chest strap in the washing machine after detaching the monitor and hang the strap to dry. However, this stand alone monitor is expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Buy lotsa batteries
customer_reviews.text: After 7 other monitors, inclding a Polar that had someting called ANT that was to complicated for this boomer to use, I found this one. Battery lasts for 2 -3 weeks using it 2-3 times a week for 1/2 hour at a time. At least it works, all the "smart" fitness watches I had and similar monitors were highly inaccurate pieces of junk, at least this one works and is accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey R Walker

customer_reviews.title: Does not include ECG/EKG!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the description says ECG/EKG. There is absolutely no ECG/EKG function on either app provided by Polar! Very misleading and I was very frustrated after learning this. However, the app is great for working out and I enjoy the data is provides on my heart rate and fat loss. I will keep the chest strap for those reasons but knocking a star off for the misleading description of the item.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Syncs with my Polar watch
customer_reviews.text: This chest strap, synced with my watch, helps me maintain the optimal pace during my runs. I'm not working out to hard or too easy. I think it's pretty accurate too.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin N

customer_reviews.title: It does not work with the H7 wrist watch.
customer_reviews.text: They claim it works with just about everything . I was sorely disappointed when I realized that it would not work with a Polar watch. Made no sense whatsoever. It does work great with my iPhone and Polar software, but that meant I had to have my phone with me for any activity. I think they want you to buy one of their newer model, expensive wrist watches.
customer_reviews.author: Getrforth

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile and Super Accurate. Pairs Well with FITIV Pulse IOS app!
customer_reviews.text: Low Profile and Super Accurate. Pairs Well with FITIV Pulse IOS app! That pretty much says it all. Worked great the last few workouts. Picture posted is from my workout. All data tracked with H10. Well worth the $$!
customer_reviews.author: TURBODRIVER24

customer_reviews.title: Tight strap and dropped connections but still the most accurate
customer_reviews.text: Tighter fitting strap than the prior versions. I use the Polar app and watch and I lose connection with both the phone and watch at least 2-3x. I'm using Bluetooth headphones at the same the same time and I'm not sure if that has something to do with it. Maybe it's the type of workout which is either CrossFit or indoor climbing. Still the most accurate on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Yoo Shin

customer_reviews.title: Did not used the monitor for more than 3 x a week for 3 weeks and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this item but it stopped working less than 4 weeks after I bought it I was really looking forward to my Saturday workout and ended up trying to make this thing work again for 30 min. It was so frustrating and I just decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lu Al

customer_reviews.title: Measures up short....
customer_reviews.text: Superior signal pickup compared to a prior model more than a decade old. Latest BT connection works well on older LeMond stationary bike. Syncing and tracking with a modern iOS device app is not so easy to do. Unimpressive online &poor results so far. Will need to call someone for help.
customer_reviews.author: scottmc

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep track of my daily heartrate and better manage my daily anxiety. It was accurate. It runs on 3v disc batteries and would last about 30 hours before I needed to replace the battery. The last time I replaced the battery, it stopped functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Kruick

customer_reviews.title: no watch, it’s just a chest strap
customer_reviews.text: I thought this is a heart rate monitor like the another chest strap & watch I used to have. The name displayed says “Heart Rate Monitor”. It’s actually just a sensor, the chest strap only, no watch. I wanted to use this for outdoor runs. Without a watch to monitor the HR live, it’s kind of useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: PlayRight

customer_reviews.title: Phenonmenal Heart Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love that I can replace the batteries myself! I really like the app you download on your phone and how it displays and the heat data it displays! Totally beats having to wear a watch band with this. Much easier to read the data on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne I. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for heart rate monitoring.
customer_reviews.text: The BPM monitor on the commercial treadmill I purchased was awful. This allows me to easily and comfortably keep track of my heart right. I didnt think I'd like something being strapped to me but it's so light I dont even think about it. Once it was set up to my treadmill I never have to think about it again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Torres

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend:  Much better than the GARMIN HRM
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for the GARMIN HRM that lasted for 2 weeks. The Polar’s chest strap is much better; it has never slid down as the Garmin’s strap. The Polar’s hardware is designed much better, a bit bulkier than the GARMIN. However, I’d take the bulkier over the GARMIN as the GARMIN literally fell apart after 2 weeks of usage. I commute 38 miles every other day and ride longer on the weekends. I’ve had much experience with both HRM’s.
customer_reviews.author: John Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Works great out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this to replace my Suunto Smart Sensor that I use with an AMBIT3 watch. If you use a Suunto watch and are tired of the way too high/low HR readings, or the dreaded ----, then get the Polar H10 today. The chest strap fits great, won't roll-up on your lats and will easily pair with any Suunto producr from AMBIT3 on up.
customer_reviews.author: wickgixxer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better than Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I have the red colored Garmin runner and I tried the blue water Garmin. The red Garmin worked fine, but I was never able to connect the blue Garmin with my watches which are also Garmin. So I ordered this one and it connected instantly and it also connects automatically with my NordicTrack Treadmill and my Octane Zero Runner. This is the way it should work, not having to fiddle back and forth with the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Got this to measure HRV and heart rate during workouts and love it! It was easy to set up and use, seems to give accurate readings, and is comfortable to wear during workouts. I've only used it with the Elite HRV app and have had no compatibility issues. 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: works with my sammsung Health and other workout apps
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product. I was up and running in 3 minutes. The strap is not very comfortable but it works great. It even works with my Elliptical Machine. The app needs some work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product description and support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Wahoo heart rate sensor that failed to work after about three years of use with Strava. Product description indicated the H10 is compatible with Strava however it appears one has to link the Polar app to Strava to transfer data, it does not link directly. If trying to use the Polar app (Polar Beat) it does not report altitude, this is apparently an extra-cost option. Polar Product Support was not helpful, just re-stated the above. Polar app does a whole lot of training tracking, with lots of features I don't need and does not do the simple one of altitude tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Shimei

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I waa nervous from other reviews but I decided to try it anyway bc I'm def not spending $$ on a fitbit. I love this thing!! I workout 5-6xs a week and use it every time. Have used for a couple weeks now , it's so accurate and easy to use with the app. Mine connected immediately. I have a Galaxy S10+. I love the summary it gives at the end also. Love it! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Tina

customer_reviews.title: Very relaible
customer_reviews.text: I always use it during my workouts.. running.. cycling.. gym strength training.. Very accurate.. I compared the heart rate with my Galaxy watch and it gives me a very close reading always!! It works with so many mobile applications effortlessly! I'm planning to test it in swimming.. while being away from my mobile phone.. which will require H10 internal storage and then sync the results to the phone when I get back onshore. Probably I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Fahad Alyafei

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heart rate monitor. Works well and is comfortable. Works better than my Apple Watch for running and more strenuous exercises. I use it with the Apple Watch to monitor my heart rate progress.
customer_reviews.author: shelby Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me, no issues at all
customer_reviews.text: Having come from using an optical sensor for the past couple years this thing is a blessing. My last monitor wouldn’t record the first 5 mins of every session until my skin warmed up. This doesn’t have that problem and my workouts are now even more accurate. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: great product - download the app!
customer_reviews.text: polar is a top brand and this thing works great. i had some problems at first connecting to my phone without the app installed. installed the app and everything communicates perfectly. the app has gotten a lot better in the last year and i no longer feel the need to use the other trackers that i had. i use this 5-6 days a week and it has never given me any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Real time information to maximize your work outs.
customer_reviews.text: If you want an accurate measure of your workout or if you want to maximize your result, this combined with the Polar Beat app is an excellent choice. Record, analyze , and Track your workouts on your phone with no hidden charges.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: Love mine
customer_reviews.text: I love the strap , can not imagine working out without it . I also have the polar ignite and both are very precise and easy to use . I had 2 babes and I am in med school and don’t have the time to spend like before on my fitness , with the strap I can make sure I have quality work outs .
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect until you have to replace the battery. Once the battery stoped working I bought a new one and replaced it and it hasn’t work since then. It will not connect to any Bluetooth devices once the original battery dies. Don’t buy and waste your money!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit?
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple of these and this one does not work as advertised and does not work in a pool, as my other one does. The latest one I bout says it was sold from 1st Avenue Superstore. Wondering if Polar has indeed gone bad, or this is a knock-off as many things are on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Work as described
customer_reviews.text: Have used it four times pairing with my Wahoo, Kinetic app and Zwift app without issues. Not my first Polar HRM product. I apply a light film of ultrasonic transmission gel for good contact and the gel will not dry. Will update review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lee

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this tool even for martial arts Training
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact, even enough to give accurate reading while doing Brazilian Jiujitsu and other contact martial arts. The app is pretty user friendly and it is a great tool. Quality purchase for sure! Professor Benjamin Moriniere "Sensei" at Moriniere Martial Arts Academy in Okinawa. Japan.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Sensei

customer_reviews.title: Good heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed this heart rate monitor during exercise for the past month. It seems to keep accurate measurementsI and keeps me from overexerting myself. The operation is fairly simple. The app keeps daily charts of your exercises. It was just what I was looking for. It works every time it was not hard to set up.
customer_reviews.author: pl4

customer_reviews.title: Not much a great difference with older version
customer_reviews.text: It’s nothing much great difference between 7 and 10, except minor accuracy, which may be significant for athletes. I think they did good job with feel. It’s comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time yesterday. I did an hour on my treadmill that is not Bluetooth. I used the Polar App and I like the way it kept track of my session. The heart rate seemed to be very accurate. Very easy to use. Time will tell how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: GWP

customer_reviews.title: Rarely connects to MapMyRun properly
customer_reviews.text: The device is connected to my iPhone through Bluetooth, and I use MapMyRun to record my workouts. Rarely does this device accurately record my heart rate. I've tried licking the sensor, using gels, and sprays, etc. Nothing works. I always get spotty heart rate data. Sadly not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: hamiltonia

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy/comfortable to wear. I wanted it so I did not have to wear my apple watch while working out... I hate tan lines! It was interesting to see where my heart was in the exercise cycle... I highly recommmend.
customer_reviews.author: 507fds

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I like it and it doesn’t disturb your working out I get to see what my workout like and it tells me when I’m burning fat or being fit!! I love the accuracy worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Tb

customer_reviews.title: Issues after battery with battery change
customer_reviews.text: The reason for my review stars is constant issues after I had to change battery. Its never worked properly since. Contacted Polar they suggested removing app and adding it back . Its been more times than i can count that i have had to do that . I came to the conclusion this is defected. I will just use my apple watch or try another HR monitor brand. Its been a year since purchased and it worked for 4-5 of that year
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful device!
customer_reviews.text: Polar's H10 is great. It works perfectly with my Peloton and also Polar watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the monitor that came with the Peloton. (I lost it..yikes) this works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Best heart monitor
customer_reviews.text: Works with all the latest technologies. I use it with my concept 2 rowing machine and all my gym machines. When my apple watch says 210bpm I can now check with the polar and it will say something more normal maybe 120. Works with the Elite HRV (which is free)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

product_meta.title: POLAR H10 Heart Rate Monitor Chest Strap - ANT + Bluetooth, Waterproof HR Sensor for Men and Women (New)
product_meta.description: Polar H10 Bluetooth/ANT+ Heart Rate SensorAlready the gold standard for consistent and accurate heart rate recording, the updated Polar H10 is now even more versatile by integrating ANT+ wireless technology. With its enhanced compatibility, the Polar H10 can be used with an endless selection of Polar devices, 3rd party wearables and apps that receive heart rate via Bluetooth or ANT+. When indoors, the Polar H10 transmits heart rate via its 5 kHz coded frequency to many pieces of exercise equipment. Get the most out of your training with the Polar H10.Connectivity: Polar H10 is compatible with top fitness apps, smart & sport watches, gym equipment and many other Bluetooth and ANT+ devices. Polar H10 can be connected to Bluetooth and ANT+ devices simultaneously.
feature_bullets: WORKS WITH EVERYTHING: Polar HRM works with many sports and smart watches (Polar, Garmin, Apple, Suunto, etc.), Polar Beat, fitness apps such as Strava and Nike, and ALL HRM compatible Cardio Equipment

SUPREME ACCURACY: Widely recognized for its top precision by many sources, Polar H10 is the most accurate heart rate sensor in Polar’s history. Polar H10 provides top quality heart rate measurement and it's the choice of many pro athletes.

CONNECTIVITY: Bluetooth, ANT+ and 5 kHz provide an excellent variety of connection options (e.g. with Peloton). You can use Bluetooth and ANT+ connections simultaneously as well as two Bluetooth connections simultaneously.
POLAR PRO CHEST STRAP: With improved electrodes, an easy-to-use buckle and silicone dots, the strap is comfortable and interference-free, and stays put when you're on the move.
VERSATILITY: Wear Polar HR monitor when rowing, cycling, running, training indoors or swimming. Polar H10 is fully waterproof and it has internal memory for one training session.
SOFTWARE UPDATES: Via Polar Beat app to keep your HRM up-to-date; Materials: Strap: 38% Polyamide, 29% Polyurethane, 20% Elastane, 13% Polyester, Silicone prints.

Operating temperature : -10 °C to +50 °C / 14 °F to 122 °F. Compatibility-iOS mobile devices: iPhone 5 and later, with iOS 11 or later; Android mobile devices with Bluetooth 4.0 capability and Android 5.0 or later

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
